item.title: Couple Questions About Items
item.dc:creator: @Mental_Piracy Mental Piracy
item.description:
@Mental_Piracy wrote:

[quote=“Nullz, post:7, topic:332306”]idunno wtf happening claws are still 60 def.
added in order what you told me.[/quote]
Because ytuio9 did it backwards…do this

if (ItemName.equals("Dragon claws") { return 1; } else if (ItemName.startsWith("Dragon") && !ItemName.endsWith("claws") { return 60;
What this does is any item that starts with dragon will return 60, unless the item also ends in claws. In which case it will not return anyting, then it will default to the other one.

@ ytuio9, please read your code an make sure its actually correct before posting and the } else SHOULD be there seeing as the dragon wearing if statements come around in the middle of the defence getting method.

Read full topic

item.title: Couple Questions About Items
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

or write one line of code like this:

if (ItemName.equals("Dragon") && !ItemName.endsWith("claws")) {
            return 1;
} else if (ItemName.startsWith("Dragon")) {
            return 60;

and raams, you forgot to remove the first else, that will give you an else without if error.

item.title: Couple Questions About Items
item.dc:creator: @Raams Raams
item.description:
@Raams wrote:

Move the Dragon claws infront of Dragon lol.

You see, when it goes through the command it does whatever it can first. So basically when its looking for “Dragon claws” it will find “Dragon” first because thats in the name and it will return 60 and stop searching through the rest of the code.

EDIT:

} else if (ItemName.equals("Dragon claws")) {
            return 1;
} else if (ItemName.startsWith("Dragon")) {
            return 60;

Very simple.

Read full topic

item.title: Couple Questions About Items
item.dc:creator: @Mental_Piracy Mental Piracy
item.description:
@Mental_Piracy wrote:

For the knives figure out how to do it yourself, its not very hard, or try the search button for a change.
For your dragon claws returning 60 defence it has to do with the fact that there is another if statement in your wearing class that is if(name.startsWith(“Dragon”)) { return 60; } it should also have a bunch of !name.endsWith() that makes any item name thats posted with the ! in front of it will not return 60, you have to add something like !name.endsWith(“claws”) and it will stop returning 60

Read full topic

if (ItemName2.startsWith(“claws”)

return 60;
